artist: Artist: Yoda Chikkoku; Artist: Yamamoto Suiun; Artist: Yamamoto Shōtō; Artist: Ōkubo Shibutsu; Artist: Magata Dairei; Artist: Kameda Bōsai
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Betty and Bruce Alberts
description: four different illustrations of flowers with seals and inscriptions: ULQ, small sprig with leaves and tiny yellow and white buds; yellow hollyhock at URQ; magnolia branch LLQ; violets LRC
inscription:
Signatures, Inscriptions, Marks, and Seals

URQ: [Same species, different flowers, both called k\'uei; The central element, earth, produced their memorable color. Richly flourishing, they open in the midst of summer\'s hot wind; Are they willing that the mountain recluse named Li should follow?  -Bosai]; LRQ: [The immortal in charge of documents in the Jade Emperor’s outer court/
Has been banished to the world of men–-how many years have passed?/ Wishing to memorialize the Flower King on matters close to his heart,/ With purple brush he leisurely inscribes this paper of tinted clouds.  - Old man Shibutsu]
markings: Japanese inscription on back near top when rolled; square relief seal on R when rolled; two-part oval relief URC: [Bosai]; square intaglio ULQ; gourd-shaped relief R center; rectangular relief center R edge; two-part rectangular relief LRQ; square relief LRQ; gourd-shaped relief LRQ
title: Flowers and Poems
